tasks.task: Evaluating plant stands and determining winter wheat survival
subtasks: Counting plants in multiple areas of the field
Assessing the vigor of the plants
Considering uniformity and patchiness in the stand
Checking for winter kill using the bag test method
Considering factors affecting winter survival (environmental conditions, variety, plant size and vigor)
Understanding the relationship between plant stand and yield
Identifying winter annual weed species (e.g., church sheet, Japanese brome, downy brome)
Differentiating between weed species based on pubescence, ligule, and seed head characteristics
Understanding the life cycles and control options for key weeds (foxtail barley, pricky lettuce, horseweed, field pennycress, false chamomile)
Considering integrated pest management strategies (chemical and mechanical control)
Monitoring and managing glyphosate-resistant weeds (Kochia)
Evaluating the need for pre-emergence and post-emergence herbicide applications
Considering the use of growth regulators and ALS inhibitors for weed control
Understanding nitrogen requirements and yield potential for winter wheat
Considering the optimal timing and rate of nitrogen application (seeding time vs. spring application)
Evaluating the impact of nitrogen on protein content and yield
Considering soil test results and environmental factors in nitrogen management
Assessing the potential for nitrogen loss and adjusting application methods (e.g., ESN, UAN placement)
Monitoring plant development and applying nitrogen accordingly (e.g., fall application, watery stage nitrogen)
Recognizing the importance of fungicide applications for disease control
Understanding the optimal timing for fungicide application (early flower stage)
Evaluating the effectiveness of different fungicide products (e.g., Pissarro, tebuconazole)
Considering the benefits of integrated fungicide and herbicide treatments
Monitoring disease occurrence (e.g., tan spot, scab, stripe rust) and adjusting management strategies
Following research and extension recommendations for effective disease management
Monitoring for glyphosate-resistant weeds (Kochia) and adjusting management practices
Evaluating alternative herbicide products for resistant populations
Implementing a rotation of herbicide modes of action
Considering the role of mechanical cultivation in managing resistant weeds
Monitoring the development of resistance and staying informed on best management practices

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Evaluating plant stands and determining winter wheat survival
